headline.main: CAPT. PEASE MEDAL GIVEN TO PARENTS; President Makes Posthumous Award to Flier Lost in Solomon Islands Battle HIS HEROIC DEED PRAISED He Took Unserviceable Plane into Fight and Brought Down Japanese Zeros

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 -- The Congressional Medal of Honor was awarded posthumously to Captain Harl Pease Jr., of Plymouth, N.H., for "gallantry and intrepidity above and beyond the call of duty" in combat with Japanese airplanes in the New Guinea area last August.
abstract: Roosevelt presents to Capt H Pease Jr's parents his Cong Medal of Honor posthumously awarded for role in Rabaul raid; illus; Pease por
